findings.title: Reentrancy vulnerability in withdrawBalance
findings.explanation: The contract performs an external call to msg.sender with call.value(userBalance[msg.sender])() before resetting the user's balance, allowing a malicious contract to re-enter withdrawBalance and drain funds.
findings.fix_suggestion: Follow the Checks-Effects-Interactions pattern: update userBalance[msg.sender] to zero before making the external call, or use transfer() which limits gas and reverts on failure.

findings.title: Potential integer overflow in addToBalance
findings.explanation: The function adds msg.value to userBalance[msg.sender] without overflow checks, which could wrap the balance value and lead to incorrect accounting.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use a SafeMath library for addition or include a require statement to ensure userBalance[msg.sender] + msg.value >= userBalance[msg.sender] before performing the addition.
